de.hohenheim.view.mobile

Class TrainFigure

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.draw2d.Figure
      • de.hohenheim.view.mobile.AnimationFigure
        • de.hohenheim.view.mobile.TrainFigure
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.eclipse.draw2d.IFigure

    public class TrainFigure
extends AnimationFigure
    Version:
    1.0 This class represents a ForkTruck. To exist in the system a mobile object must be located in a RoomMap. This means either in a Room or on a Path between rooms. When the mobileFigure Object is instantiated, this Object must be located in a room, for example in the "entrance" of the RoomMap.
    Author:
    Arthur Kaul, Besim Gashi, Mathias Zwiesele, Daniel Intili, Bernd Hofs‰ﬂ

      • TrainFigure

        public TrainFigure(NodeMap map,
           NodeFigure in_room,
           int id,
           java.lang.Object modellObject)
        Constructor. Sets the mobile object we want to create inside a room (as starting point)
        Parameters:
        {@link - NodeMap} map - The map where the figure should be placed.
        NodeFigure - The Room where the mobile object is located when it is instantiated.
        int - id - a unique id for the fork truck.

    • Method Detail

      • isShowBusy

        public boolean isShowBusy()
        Returns the current state of the busy indicator. i.e. if the busyindicator is visible in the moment or not. This method is used by an animator, e.g. to draw a blinking rectangle which indicates if the figure is busy/waiting.
        Overrides:
        isShowBusy in class AnimationFigure
        Returns:
        boolean "isBusyRectangleVisible"

        private org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image getTrainImage(int id)

      • walkTo

        public void walkTo(NodeFigure room)
        An animation from the current position to a room. The mobile object must be in a room or on a path which is connected to the room it wants to go.
        Parameters:
        NodeMap - The RoomMap where the animation should be done.
        NodeFigure - The Room the mobile object shall go.

      • busy

        public void busy(int busy_time)
        Starts an animation which shows that the fork truck is waiting/busy. Waits till the busy_time is over.
        Parameters:
        int - busy_time. The time the fork truck is waiting/busy.

      • waitFor

        public void waitFor(State state)
        Starts an animation which shows that the fork truck is waiting/busy. Waits till the state object has the value UNBLOCKED.
        Parameters:
        State - state. The State of n object the fork truck is waiting for.
